DataElement.preferredName: Prior Hypomethylation Therapy Receive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study that address the prior receipt of therapies (hypomethylating agents) that target the activity of DNA methyltransferases.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Hypomethylation Therapy Receive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Therapies that target the activity of DNA methyltransferases. Hypomethylating agents, including azacitidine and decitabine, have been used in the therapy of myelodysplastic syndrome and secondary acute myeloid leukemia. Although it is not curative, it can induce an improvement in hematopoiesis and lead to prolonged overall survival. Use of hypomethylating agents in the treatment of sickle cell anemia and other hemoglobin disorders can trigger the expression of fetal hemoglobin, leading to significant improvements in clinical symptoms._To take, accept, or get something offered._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Therapies that target the activity of DNA methyltransferases. Hypomethylating agents, including azacitidine and decitabine, have been used in the therapy of myelodysplastic syndrome and secondary acute myeloid leukemia. Although it is not curative, it can induce an improvement in hematopoiesis and lead to prolonged overall survival. Use of hypomethylating agents in the treatment of sickle cell anemia and other hemoglobin disorders can trigger the expression of fetal hemoglobin, leading to significant improvements in clinical symptoms.

Concepts.definition: Therapies that target the activity of DNA methyltransferases. Hypomethylating agents, including azacitidine and decitabine, have been used in the therapy of myelodysplastic syndrome and secondary acute myeloid leukemia. Although it is not curative, it can induce an improvement in hematopoiesis and lead to prolonged overall survival. Use of hypomethylating agents in the treatment of sickle cell anemia and other hemoglobin disorders can trigger the expression of fetal hemoglobin, leading to significant improvements in clinical symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received prior th
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with hypomethylating agents (5-azacytidine, decitabine, SGI-110)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior hypomethylating agent (HMA) therapy for more than one full cycle in treatment for prior MDS or MPN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior MDS/MPN-directed therapy, AML or MDS-directed therapy including lenalidomide and hypomethylating agent (HMAs) such as decitabine or azacitidine, excluding hydroxyurea?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been previously treated with azacytidine, decitabine, or venetoclax?
